sentences.sContent: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.
...The elaborate patterns were believed to offer protection against evil...
...when her investors threatened to shut her down: “I was probably up against the most fear I’ve ever had，” she says...
...to raise objections against another man's speech...
...Isn't this the same crowd that rails against processed junk and champions craft cooking...
...The author was advised against the improper use of figures of speech...
...A lawyer from the district attorney’s office presents a case against the suspect...
...including a couple of fatty children with swollen cheeks pressing against their eyes...
...they would support government measures against sugar consumption...
...And nowhere did a wife have legal protection against family violence...

phrases.pCn: 在…对面；正对着；与…相反；与…形成对照

trans.tranOther: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support
